alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 2:07AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY MONDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 to 10 inches. Localized areas above 9500 feet elevation could see up to 12 inches of additional snowfall accumulation. Winds gusting as high as 70-75 mph in localized areas today. Blowing snow will create visibility reductions of less than 1 mile at times through this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 18 to 36 inches possible. Localized areas up to 48 inches of snowfall above 9500 feet in elevation possible. Winds could gust as high as 75 mph, creating the potential for blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from early Monday morning through early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel could be very difficult to impossible due to near zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow, especially with the second round Monday through Wednesday night. Outdoor recreation could become life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers, skiers, and snowmobilers may easily become lost or disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a long duration event. While there may be occasional lulls in snowfall, periodic moderate to heavy snowfall with very strong winds will be possible from Sunday through early Thursday, and possibly longer. Strong winds and blowing snow with possible whiteout conditions will be possible even during lulls in falling snow. Blizzard conditions are possible as well. Be prepared for several days of difficult conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes on Wednesday and Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
